alert.note: Alert for Creek; Okmulgee; Osage; Tulsa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 02 at 8:39PM CDT until May 02 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, Creek, Okmulgee, Osage, Rogers and Tulsa. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 837 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.0 and 2.0 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Sand Springs... Bristow... Owasso... Bixby... Sapulpa... Jenks... Glenpool... Catoosa... Mannford... Drumright... Kiefer... Beggs... Sperry... Mounds... Kellyville... Depew... Slick... Shamrock... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
